column5: NEW YORK  Aug 22 Trading was halted on the Nasdaq  the second-largest U.S. stock exchange  shortly after noon on Thursday because of technical problems  while stocks rose as other U.S. markets continued to  operate.

column4: HP CEO on the prowl for acquisitions up to $1.5 billion
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Hewlett-Packard Co is back in the market for acquisitions of up to $1.5 billion  Chief Executive Meg Whitman said in a televised interview on Thursday  aiming for smaller deals after a flurry of outsized purchases in past years.

column4: UPDATE 1-HP CEO on the prowl for acquisitions up to $1.5 bln
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Aug 22 Hewlett-Packard Co  is back in the market for acquisitions of up to $1.5 billion  Chief Executive Meg Whitman said in a televised interview on Thursday  aiming for smaller deals after a flurry of outsized purchases in past years.

column4: US STOCKS-Trading halted on Nasdaq  stocks rise slightly
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 22 Trading was halted on the Nasdaq stock exchange on Thursday because of technical problems while U.S. stocks rose slightly.

column4: HP could do acquisitions up to $1.5 bln -CEO
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 22 Hewlett-Packard Co sees acquisitions as part of the No. 1 PC maker's future and it could do deals up to $1.5 billion  Chief Executive Meg Whitman told cable network CNBC on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 4-HP shuffles top ranks  dashes 2014 growth hopes
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 21 Hewlett-Packard Co  shuffled its top ranks on Wednesday  shifting a star executive to a role identifying acquisition targets after a disappointing performance from the division he oversaw curtailed the No. 1 PC maker's 2014 outlook.

column4: METALS-Copper climbs on China manufacturing data
column5: LONDON  Aug 22 Copper rose on Thursday after manufacturing data for August from top metals consumer China suggested the world's second-biggest economy might be stabilising and its demand for commodities could pick up.

column4: HSBC to expand business with German midsize firms
column5: DUESSELDORF  Germany  Aug 22 HSBC plans to expand its business with midsize German companies  including through acquisitions  the bank's Germany chief Andreas Schmitz said on Thursday.

column2: JC Penney Company Inc Holding Company
column4: Penney takes step to ward off any coercive takeover methods
column5: Aug 22 J.C. Penney Co Inc on Thursday said it adopted a one-year stockholder rights plan to protect against a potential future use of coercive methods to take the company over.

column4: BRIEF-RSM Tenon appoints administrators
column5: Aug 22 RSM Tenon Group PLC :  * Appointment of administrators  * No longer in talks with baker tilly regarding a possible offer for the issued

column4: UPDATE 1-Pentagon cuts F-35 operating estimate below $1 trln -source
column5: WASHINGTON  Aug 21 The U.S. government has slashed its estimate for the long-term operating costs of Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 fighter jets by more than 20 percent to under $1 trillion  according to a senior defense official  a move that could boost international support for the program.

column4: Thailand approves Japan MUFG's buy of Bank of Ayudhya-Finmin
column5: BANGKOK  Aug 22 Thailand has approved a bid by Japan's Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) to buy a 75 percent stake in Thailand's Bank of Ayudhya Pcl  Finance Minister Kittirat Na Ranong said on Thursday.

column4: Morgan Stanley fined $1 million over bond pricing violations
column5: WASHINGTON Morgan Stanley will pay a $1 million fine and compensate harmed investors to settle civil charges that the bank failed to give customers the best market prices for some corporate and municipal bonds  U.S. brokerage regulators said on Thursday.

column4: Nasdaq market paralyzed by three hour shutdown
column5: NEW YORK Trading in thousands of U.S. stocks ground to a halt for much of Thursday after an unexplained technological problem shut down trading in Nasdaq securities  the latest prominent disruption to the operations of U.S. markets.

column4: Nasdaq says connectivity issue caused trading halt
column5: NEW YORK Nasdaq OMX  said a connectivity issue between an exchange participant and the Securities Information Processor  which consolidates stock prices  was the reason behind Thursday's more than three hour trading halt in all Nasdaq-listed securities.

column4: Pandora earnings forecast disappoints  shares drop
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Internet radio service Pandora Media Inc  said on Thursday that rising expenditures to acquire music and compete with rivals would push fiscal 2014 earnings below analyst expectations  and its shares slumped 5 percent.

column4: UPDATE 2-Pandora earnings forecast disappoints  shares drop
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 22 Internet radio service Pandora Media Inc said on Thursday that rising expenditures to acquire music and compete with rivals would push fiscal 2014 earnings below analyst expectations  and its shares slumped 5 percent.

column4: CORRECTED-Pandora reports second quarter adjusted revenue is up 58 percent
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 22 Pandora Media Inc  the Internet radio service  reported that quarterly revenue on an adjusted basis rose 58 percent to $162 million as it continued to pick up listeners.

column4: PetroChina Q2 profit rises 29 percent  beats forecast
column5: HONG KONG PetroChina Co Ltd   the country's dominant oil and gas producer which also owns refineries  posted a 29 percent rise in its second-quarter profit  beating analyst estimates.

column4: UPDATE 1-Brazil denies reports of imminent fuel price increase
column5: BRASILIA  Aug 22 Brazil's President Dilma Rousseff has not yet discussed raising gasoline and diesel prices to support state-run oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA   her spokesman said in response to local media reports on Thursday.

column4: GameStop boosts profit forecast on console outlook; stock jumps
column5: GameStop Corp raised its 2013 earnings forecast on Thursday  counting on new consoles from Microsoft Corp and Sony Corp to boost holiday season spending on video games and reverse the sector's decline. | Video

These notes are senior  unsecured obligations of Southern  Company. The Rating Outlook is Stable.
